W6eI97Ii.question: An accident is an occurrence associated with the operation of an aircraft which:

options.text: takes place between the time any person boards the aircraft with the intention of flight until such time as all such persons have disembarked where a person is fatally or seriously injured.
takes place between the time aircraft is in flight until such time as it lands where a person is fatally or seriously injured.
takes place between the time any person boards the aircraft with the intention of flight until such time as it stops engines where a person is fatally or seriously injured.
takes place between the time any passenger boards the aircraft with the intention of flight until such time as all such passengers have disembarked where a person is fatally or seriously injured.

AUoZ4toz.question: When the accident or the serious incident has occurred in the territory of a non-Contracting State (to ICAO Convention) which does not intend to conduct an investigation in accordance with Annex 13:

options.text: All of the above.
The State of Registry should itself conduct an investigation with such information as is available.
When the location of the accident cannot definitely be established as being in the territory of any State, the State of Registry shall conduct investigation of the accident.
The State of Registry should attempt to conduct an investigation in cooperation with the State of Occurrence.

8JFDaYqx.question: An aircraft lands at the destination with less than 30 minutes fuel. This is reported as:

options.text: Serious Incident.
As long as the aircraft land safely, there is no need to report.
Accident.
Incident.

n5dS2RlD.question: An aircraft accident takes place in the sea, in the territory of State A. The aircraft is registered in State B. The conduct of the investigation is the responsibility of (1)___ and shall normally include, if possible, the determination of the causes and/or (2)___.

options.text: (1) State A; (2) contributing factors
(1) State A; (2) faults to apportion blame
(1) State B; (2) contributing factors
(1) State B; (2) faults to apportion blame

uduW3Ol7.question: The principal objective of a rescue and fire fighting service at an aerodrome is to

options.text: save lives.
preserve aircraft.
respond within 3 minutes.
respond within 2 minutes.

RjYIdWq0.question: In accordance with Annex 12, what does the ground-air visual signal code LL used by rescue units mean?

options.text: We have found all personnel.
Require medical assistance.
Operation completed.
We have found only some personnel.

k1ByL0LR.question: Which one of the following occurrences should be voluntarily reported?

options.text: Debris in walkway.
Collisions, near collisions or potential for collisions.
Structural defects.
Crew incapacitation.

h4Vh0GbY.question: One of the most important factors bearing on effective rescue in a survivable aircraft accident is

options.text: the received training of the firefighters.
the size of the recovery and rescue machines and tools.
the number of available fire extinguishers.
the speed of the firetrucks.

jh9dpHzI.question: The sole objective of the investigation of an accident or incident shall be the;

options.text: prevention of accidents or incidents.
prevention of accidents or incidents and to provide legal evidence for subsequent court cases.
prevention of accidents or incidents and to provide the manufacturer with investigation data for the improvement of the design.
prevention of accidents or incidents and to establish liability.

o70adSjS.question: Which of the following frequencies are used for emergency operations by SAR aircraft?

options.text: 121.5 MHz and 243.0 MHz.
121.5 MHz and 243.0 kHz.
119.7 MHz and 6 182 MHz.
119.7 MHz and 2 182 kHz.

LEgH7Jpt.question: According ICAO Annex 13, a contracting state is obligated to investigate an accident/incident:

options.text: within its state but not over high seas.
within its state and over high seas.
everywhere.
within states which are cooperating with EASA.

ue0rUWJl.question: An aircraft is subjected to a failure of the engine and its turbine blade is broken. What is this occurrence classified as?

options.text: Serious Incident
Serious accident
Accident
Incident

SH6cT26v.question: An aeroplane has disappeared during flight and is now missing. This would be classified as an...

options.text: accident
offence
serious incident
incident

JdnI5cyg.question: Which one of the following statements best defines an "Accident"?

options.text: An occurrence associated with the operation of an aircraft which takes place between the time any person boards the aircraft with the intention of flight until such time as all persons have disembarked, in which a person is fatally or seriously injured.
Any occurrence involving damage to an aircraft.
An occurrence, associated with the operation of an aircraft, which affects or could have affected the safety of the operation.
Any of the above providing the aircraft is seriously damaged at the same time.
it is classified as an accident.
it is classified as an serious incident.
it is classified as an incident.
it is classified as an uncertainty.

NQgMuKVU.question: During flight, a low fuel alert suddenly appears, and the commander initiates an emergency diversion to an alternate airport. During the landing roll, a tire deflates. After parking, it is noted that the fuel remaining is below the required 30 minute final reserve. What has occurred?

options.text: A serious incident.
A serious accident.
An incident.
An accident.

DNYXO9O7.question: Regulation (EU) No 376/2014 on the reporting, analysis and follow-up of occurences in civila aviation lays down rules on the...

options.text: occurence reporting, analysis and dissemination of safety information.
certification and maintenance of aircraft.
issuance of Acceptable Means of Compliance and Guidance Material for investigation reports.
safety investigation into accidents and serious incidents in order to prevent future accidents and incidents.

2ieg1428.question: An aircraft has crashed in France. Its state of registry is the USA and the company is Spanish. Who should contact who?

options.text: France shall notify the USA and Spain.
France shall notify the USA and the USA shall notify spain.
France shall notify Spain.
France shall notify the USA.

r49U84wp.question: According to the collection and storage policy of EU regulation No. 376/**2014**, the operator needs to designate one or more persons that would collect all the reports...

options.text: And will evaluate, process, analyze and store them while taking all the necessary measures to safeguard the confidentiality of the identity of the reporter.
And will evaluate, process, analyze and store them.
And will conduct the investigation of accidents and serious incidents with a third-party member state. But mainly the voluntary reporting occurrences.
And will evaluate them while taking all the necessary measures to safeguard the confidentiality of the identity of the reporter.

pwdkhcFz.question: Which of the following occurrences is classified as an aircraft accident?

options.text: An engineer is struck and seriously injured before a flight.
In-flight, an engine turbine destroys the engine and its cowling, but no other part of the aircraft suffers serious damage.
A cabin crew member is attacked and seriously injured by a passenger during a flight.
A stowaway is killed by falling from the undercarriage bay on approach to land.

UPOI3cKK.question: Name the difference between EU regulation No. 376/**2014** and EU regulation No. 996/**2010**.

options.text: EU regulation No. 376/2014 focuses on the reporting of occurrences and their analysis including appropriate follow-up actions, whereas EU regulation No. 996/2010 focuses more on safety investigations into accidents and serious incidents.

EU regulation No. 376/2014 focuses on the reporting of occurrences and their analysis including appropriate follow-up actions, whereas EU regulation No. 996/2010 focuses more on safety investigations into accidents and incidents.

EU regulation No. 376/2014 is a more detailed directive regarding the immediate actions and the legal framework of an accident, whereas EU regulation No. 996/2010 focuses more on safety investigations into accidents and serious incidents.
EU regulation No. 376/2014 focuses on “safe culture”, whereas EU regulation No. 996/2010 focuses more on the “just culture”.

FrsSJw07.question:
When flying en-route you intercept an emergency transmission from an aircraft in distress
Your actions will include, where possible

options.text: Acknowledge the transmission, and begin to search the aircraft in distress.
Hold at your current position and coordinate the SAR operation.
Enter a holding pattern and await instructions.
Record the bearing of the transmission, and continue on your way.

hFB4YCAD.question: On June 1st, 2009, an aircraft crashed into the South Atlantic Ocean. The country of registration was France and the country of departure Brazil. When contact was lost, the aircraft was flying over the South Atlantic Ocean in the airspace managed by the Atlantico (Brazil) and Dakar (Senegal) oceanic centres. Which country is responsible for the aircraft accident report?

options.text: The state conducting the investigation.
France.
Brazil.
The ATS unit which was last in contact with the aircraft.

yTFelLPY.question: What is meant by the term 'response time', regarding rescue and fire fighting (RFF) at an aerodrome?

options.text: The time between the initial call to the rescue and fire fighting service, and the time when the first responding vehicle is in position to apply foam.
The time between the observation of the accident, and the time when the first responding vehicle is approaching the scene of accident.
The time between the initial call to the rescue and fire fighting service, and the time when the first responding vehicle is leaving the station.
The time between the initial call to the rescue and fire fighting service, and the time when the first responding vehicle is approaching the scene of accident.

x5a9A86y.question: During a flight from Prague to Vienna, an in-flight loss of control occurred. The European Regulation on Air Operations includes rules on reporting such occurrences. This Regulation has been:

options.text: Drafted by EASA for the European Commission.
Drafted by the European Commission.
Drafted by EASA and Eurocontrol.
Prepared by the JAA.

YNlW2pTX.question: An aircraft has suffered damage to the landing gear and fuselage, as well as experiencing an AIRPROX. These two events are classified as:

options.text: Accident and Serious Incident.
Accident and incident.
Serious incident and incident.
Both serious incident.

QYNE8wGs.question: An aircraft is flying over the threshold prior to touchdown when the pilots observe a vehicle crossing the runway and take immediate action to go around to avoid causing a collision between the aircraft and the vehicle. The pilots report this incident and an investigation takes place following the procedures set out in ICAO Annex 13. What is the sole purpose of this investigation?

options.text: To prevent such incidents from occurring again.
To apportion adequate blame, or liability, on the agency or personnel responsible for the incursion.
To ensure that factual data are collated and analysed for use in any subsequent judicial proceedings.
To ensure that the flight crew, air traffic control and any additional units or agencies followed the correct operating procedures.

TSSG6sQD.question: A pilot encountering windshear should report the fact to ATC

options.text: as soon as possible.
only if windshear has not been previously reported.
only if windshear has not been forecast.
if windshear has not been forecast or reported.

3rQKMdtQ.question: After landing, while taxiing towards the apron the landing gear sinks into a hole. Nobody gets injured, but the aircraft sustains a structural failure. This obliges the crew to delay the departure.

options.text: This is an accident and the crew must follow the procedure relevant to this case.
This is an incident and the pilot-in-command must report it to the airport authority within the next 48 hours.
Since there is no person injured and the flight is terminated, a damage report has to be made out with the services of the aerodrome in charge of the runway and taxiways for the insurance company.
This is an irregularity in the operation. The crew must inform the operator of the aerodrome and establish a report.

FSwbirbU.question: Except when necessary for take-off or landing, a VFR flight over congested areas of cities, towns or settlements or over an open air assembly of persons shall not be flown at a height less than

options.text: 300 m above the highest obstacle within a radius of 600 m from the aircraft.
600 m above the highest obstacle within a radius of 300 m from the aircraft.
300 m above the highest obstacle within a radius of 600 ft from the aircraft.
300 m above the highest obstacle.

f7Rq4i5Z.question: Which of the following statements about EU regulation No. 996/**2010** and EU regulation No. 376/**2014** describes the correct relationships?

options.text: Both, EU regulation No. 996/2010, and EU regulation No. 376/2014, aim to improve aviation safety, whereas 996/2010 focuses on investigations, and 376/2014 focuses on reporting and management of safety relevant information.

EU regulation No. 996/2010 refers to the investigation of accidents involving aircraft with a total mass of less than 5 700 kg, and EU regulation No. 376/2014 refers to the investigation of accidents involving aircraft with a total mass of more than 5 700 kg.

EU regulation No. 996/2010 aims to improve aviation safety by ensuring that relevant safety information relating to civil aviation is collected, stored, protected, exchanged, disseminated and analysed, and EU regulation No. 376/2014 aims to improve aviation safety by ensuring that relevant safety information relating to civil aviation is reported.
EU regulation No. 996/2010 refers to the investigation of incidents and occurrences, and EU regulation No. 376/2014 refers to the investigation of accidents.

IgtLI1Uu.question: If an accident or incident occurs, to report it, you should follow:

options.text: ICAO Annex 13.
ICAO Doc 8 168.
regional agreements.
ICAO Doc 7 030.

QTo9cWsi.question: In case of an accident or incident, which State is responsible for taking reasonable measures to protect the evidence and maintain safe custody of the aircraft and its contents for the purposes of an investigation? – The State of..

options.text: Occurrence.
Registry.
the Operator.
Manufacture.

hQS3xUFU.question: A pilot recognizes that he/she does not have enough enough final reserve fuel. The aircraft 40 minutes away from the departure (A) and 50 minutes to the destination (B). There is a runway of another aerodrome (C) in sight but ATC reports that the weather is below minimum. What should the pilot do?

options.text: Land at C.
Continue to B.
Return to A.
Declare an emergency and ask ATC for further instructions.

sCpvTX0A.question: According to ICAO Annex 13, a flight recorder is any type of recorder installed in the aircraft for the purpose of...

options.text: Complementing accident/incident investigation.
Allowing crews direct access to flight data.
Verifying infringements of applicable regulations.
Verifying insurance and liability issues.

Jg6qkhpG.question: The accident investigation preliminary report shall be submitted to appropriate States and to the ICAO, in:

options.text: one of the working languages of ICAO.
any of the world's major languages.
the language of the investigating State.
English.

XBx2u4Ol.question: Consider EU Regulations on accidents, incidents, and occurrences in aviation. Which of the following options is correct?

options.text: Reg.(EU) 996/2010 addresses safety investigations but excludes, amongst others, incident investigation involving military aircraft; Reg. (EU) 376/2014 adresses occurrence reporting and use of safety information in order to improve aviation safety.

Reg.(EU) 996/2010 addresses accident and incident investigations, and implements the SARPs of ICAO Annex 13; Reg.(EU) 376/2014 contains procedures for accident and incident investigations, applicable to all ICAO Member States.

Reg.(EU) 996/2010 addresses accident and incident investigations for aircraft with an MTOM > 5700 kg; Reg.(EU) 376/2014 regulates accident and incident investigations for aircraft with an MTOM =< 5700 kg.

Reg.(EU) 996/2010 contains procedures for the investigation of occurrences and incidents; Reg(EU) 376/2014 contains the procedures for the investigation of accidents: both regulations aim to prove aviation safety.

dOVSvItN.question: Which of the following statements about EU regulation No. 996/2010 and EU regulation No. 376/2014 describes the correct relationship between the two regulations and their contributions to air safety?

options.text: Both EU regulation No. 996/2010, and EU regulation No. 376/2014, aim to improve aviation safety, whereas 996/2010 focuses on investigations, and 376/2014 focuses on reporting and management of safety relevant information.
EU regulation No. 996/2010 refers to the investigation of incidents and occurrences, and EU regulation No. 376/2014 refers to the investigation of accidents.

EU regulation No. 996/2010 aims to improve aviation safety by ensuring that relevant safety information relating to civil aviation is collected, stored, protected, exchanged, disseminated and analysed, and EU regulation No. 376/2014 aims to improve aviation safety by ensuring that relevant safety information relating to civil aviation is reported.

EU regulation No. 996/2010 refers to the investigation of accidents involving aircraft with a total mass of less than 5 700 kg, and EU regulation No. 376/2014 refers to the investigation of accidents involving aircraft with a total mass of more than 5 700 kg.

90N92a8C.question: 'A situation wherein apprehension exists as to the safety of an aircraft and its occupants' is the definition for

options.text: alert phase.
emergency phase.
uncertainty phase.
distress phase.

GAGrzpmA.question: After landing, while taxiing the landing gear sinks into a hole. No person gets injured, but the aircraft sustains structural failure, which delays the departure. Which of the following correctly describes the situation and following action...

options.text: This is an accident. The crew must follow the procedure relevant to this case.
This is an incident. The pilot-in-command must report it to the airport authority within the next 48 hours.
This is a technical incident. Since there is no person injured and the flight is terminated, a damage report has to be made out for the respective insurance company.
This is an irregularity in the operation. The crew must inform the operator of the aerodrome and establish a report.

80NqArKS.question: Which one of the following occurrences must be reported?

options.text: Crew incapacitation.
Passenger sickness.
Debris in walkway.
Lost baggage.

4pT4y4rM.question: Which of the following events are subject to voluntary reporting according to EU regulation No. 376/2014?

options.text: Small speed fluctuations during approach.
Abnormal fuel check discrepancies.
Engine-failure in cruise.
TCAS RA.

bafXMqjt.question: If you are the first one who arrives at an area where an accident has happened, before search and rescue services arrive

options.text: you are oblige to stay at the location of occurrence and take on charge the coordination.
you continue your flight because all aircraft have ELTs.
you descend in intervals of 10 minutes.
you descend to 1 000 ft and circle at the location of occurrence north to south.

CkZxAHvB.question: The first officer and aircraft commander have just taken off from an airport and are now on the climb-out. The commander suddenly suffers from a major heart attack, which incapacitates him from performing as a crew member. Fortunately the First Officer is able to land the aircraft. When he/she later submits a report to the CAA the event will be classified as:

options.text: A serious incident
An incident
A serious injury
An accident

SPEMVofJ.question: For which one of the following does mandatory reporting apply?

options.text: Crew incapacitation.
Both passenger and crew sickness.
Lost baggage.
Debris in the walkway.

sSVB8xM0.question: During the flight, the crew becomes aware that a navigation instrument which has NOT been required on this flight but will be required on a future flight is indicating incorrectly. In addition to having the fault investigated by the engineers, Regulation (EU) No 376/2014 requires:

options.text: The Pilot in Command to report the occurrence to the Operator's safety reporting system within 72 hours.
The crew member who noticed the fault to report the occurrence as a serious incident to the national Civil Aviation Safety Investigation Authority within 72 hours.
Nothing more is required because the failure did NOT affect that flight.
The Pilot in Command to report the occurrence as a serious incident to the national Civil Aviation Safety Investigation Authority within 7 days.

snxxKEqC.question:
An operator shall not operate an aeroplane first issued with an individual Certificate of Airworthiness on or after 1 April 1998, which has a maximum certificated take-off mass over 5 700 kg, unless it is equipped with a cockpit voice recorder which records:
1. Voice communications transmitted from or received on the flight deck by radio.2. The aural environment of the flight deck.3. The cabin attendants communications in the cabin using the aeroplane's interphone system.4. Voice communications of flight crew members on the flight deck using the aeroplane's interphone system.5. Voice or audio signals identifying navigation or approach aids introduced into a headset or speaker.6. Voice communications of flight crew members on the flight deck using the public address system, if installed.
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:

y432ScHD.question: Search and Rescue ? What does the ground-air visual signal ?X? as used by survivors mean

options.text: Require medical assistance.
Yes or affirmative.
Require assistance.
No or negative.

11pMNz2G.question: According to ICAO Annex 13, what mass does ICAO mean when referring to the maximum mass in an accident investigation?

options.text: Maximum certificated take-off mass
Maximum zero fuel mass
Maximum landing mass
Maximum block mass

b68RUl6d.question: What is the objective of the investigation of an accident or incident, according to ICAO Annex 13 (Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation)?

options.text: To prevent accidents and incidents.
To determine the aircraft manufacturer`s liability.
To determine the operator`s liability.
To apportion blame for the subsequent legal proceedings.

nKLHk3DQ.question: According to ICAO Annex 13, what is the definition of the term accident?

options.text: A person is fatally or seriously injured, or the aircraft sustains damage or structural failure, or the aircraft is missing or is completely inaccessible.
A person receives minor injuries, or the aircraft sustains minor damage.
A person is fatally or seriously injured, or the aircraft sustains minor damage or structural failure.
An occurrence associated with the operation of an aircraft which affects or could affect the safety of operation.

RgMqedGs.question: During the climb-out phase of a flight, the pilot-in-command becomes incapacitated. The co-pilot takes control of the aircraft and returns it safely to the aerodrome of departure. What notification or reporting action must be taken after landing?

options.text: The crew must follow the procedure relevant to an incident.
The pilot-in-command or the operator must complete a report on behalf of the airport authority within 48 hours.
The operator must inform the airport authority by writing an irregularity report.
The crew must follow the procedure relevant to an accident.

kzt838kw.question: Shortly before landing the Co-Pilot reports feeling unwell and becomes incapacitated. The aircraft lands safely. How and when should the event be reported, according to Regulation (EU) No. 996/2010?

options.text: As a serious incident, to the national Civil Aviation Safety Investigation Authority, WITHOUT delay.
In a voluntary occurrence report, to the national Civil Aviation Authority, within 72 hours.
As an accident, to the national Civil Aviation Safety Investigation Authority, WITHOUT delay.
In a mandatory occurrence report, to the national Civil Aviation Authority, within 72 hours.

DMHZnSSr.question: You are flying a multi-engine aircraft and there is serious engine failure with a broken turbine. This is a(n)...

options.text: serious incident.
serious accident.
accident.
incident.

ybzDwHTT.question: During the climb-out phase of a flight, the pilot-in-command becomes incapacitated. The co-pilot takes over control of the aircraft and decides to return for landing.

options.text: The crew must follow the procedure relevant to an incident.
The pilot-in-command or the Operator must deposit a report on behalf of the involved airport Authority within the following 48 hours.
The operator must inform the Authority by writing an Irregularity Report.
The crew must follow the procedure relevant to an accident.

nEPtmbsc.question:
To which state shall the final report of an accident or serious incident be sent to with minimum delay?
1) The State of Registry
2) The State of the Operator
3) The state of Design
4) The state of Manufacture
5) The ICAO, when the aircraft involved is of a maximum mass of over 2250 kg

7yM5j6h6.question: With reference to Council Directive **2003**/42/EC, what is the definition of an 'occurrence'?

options.text: An operational interruption, defect, fault or other irregular circumstance that has or may have influenced flight safety and that has not resulted in an accident or serious incident.
An operational interruption, defect, fault or other irregular circumstance that has or may have influenced flight safety and that has or has not resulted in an accident or serious incident.
An operational interruption, defect, fault or other irregular circumstance that has or may have influenced flight safety and that has resulted in an accident or serious incident.
Any accident or incident.

g7K8U8m0.question: Which of the following events are mandatory to be reported according to EU regulation No. 376/**2014**:

options.text: Captain incapacitation due to intoxication from the crew meal.
TCAS TA.
Fuel check discrepancies within the limits of the manufacturer.
Window shades inoperative.

MmeDBFJb.question: What is the main objective of the EU regulation No. 376/2014?

options.text: Occurrence reporting in order to prevent accidents and incidents without attributing blame or liability.
Airport signs standardisation.
Accidents investigation at the Union level.
Occurrence reporting in order to prevent accidents and incidents while attributing blame or liability to the concerned crew members.

s15OxHIn.question:
During a Commercial Air Transport flight under IFR with a jet aeroplane, a warning by the fuel low level alarm was triggered. The flight crew declares an emergency and lands safely. During the landing roll, a tyre deflates. After coming to a stop, the crew cancels the distress message.
The fuel quantity measured by the Safely Investigation Authority is less than the final reserve (30 min).According to Regulation (EU) No 996/2010, this event is...

options.text: Serious incident.
Serious accident.
An accident.
An incident.

DxgU3mvP.question: A Special Air Report shall be made when

options.text: experiencing severe icing or severe turbulence.
an unruly passenger is on board.
an AIRPROX has been encountered.
the ETA changes by more than 10 minutes.

OMOampfO.question: Which of the following ICAO documents contain International Standards and Recommended Practices (SARPS)?

options.text: Annexes to the Convention on international civil aviation.
ICAO Technical Manuals.
Procedures for Air Navigation Services (PANS).
Regional Supplementary Procedures (SUPPS).

5hkqhQqT.question: To what geographical area(s) does ICAO Annex 13 Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation apply?

options.text: All geographical areas.
The territory of the Contracting States.
The territory of the Contracting States and the high seas.
All geographical areas, excluding the high seas.

0vENKRaD.question: Regulation (EU) 376/2014: When an organisation, as certified/approved by the Agency, identifies an actual/potential safety risk through the analysis of reportable occurences, then it shall share that information with the Agency:

options.text: Within 30 days from the date of notification by the reporter.
As soon as possible after it has been reported.
No later than two weeks (14 days) from the date of notification by the person listed as reporter in the original submission.
At the next scheduled safety forum.

wjwIKMDh.question: During the approach to an airfield, flying in IMC, the pilots receive a "PULL UP" warning. After the flight, the operator discovered that the aircraft was only 150ft above an obstacle.This scenario is classified as...

options.text: A Serious Incident.
A Catastrophe.
An Accident.
A "Near Miss".

ixQgwBv4.question:
Rescue and fire-fighting (emergency) services provision is categorized according to physical characteristics of the type of aeroplane using the aerodrome
This classification is based upon

options.text: aeroplane overall length and fuselage width.
maximum number of passengers and crew.
Maximum Landing Mass and maximum number of passengers.
aeroplane length and Maximum Take-off Mass.

16o2LyTb.question: An aircraft is conducting an approach to an aerodrome when there is a runway lighting failure, which eventually requires a diversion to be made. What type of report should be made?

options.text: Incident report.
Maintenance report.
Accident report.
No report is required as nobody was seriously injured or killed due to this occurrence.

59cNA9hM.question: The ICAO Annex 17 comprise rules in order to establish security measures for passengers with regards to

options.text: cabin baggage, checked baggage, cargo and other goods, access control and airport design.
cabin baggage and checked baggage and cargo.
passengers and their baggage.
cabin baggage, checked baggage, cargo and other goods and access control.

88fCMeDq.question: In the context of ICAO Annex 13, Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation, the Maximum Mass is considered to be the..

options.text: Maximum Certificated Take-Off Mass.
Maximum Structural Landing Mass.
Dry Operating Mass.
Maximum Zero Fuel Mass.

W4kmDnQL.question: The most important factors bearing on effective rescue in a survivable aircraft accident are

options.text: Training received
Number of fire fighters in attendance
Number of fire engines in attendance
Number of fire extinguishers on the aircraft

qaqjbD3u.question: During take-off, the fire alarm sounded. After a rejected take-off, all passengers are evacuated. Nobody gets hurt, however, one wing is completely burnt. This is an example of a/an...

options.text: serious incident.
serious accident.
incident.
accident.

WMwzLrJE.question:
An aircraft designed and manufactured in the United States of America (USA), registered and operated in the United Kingdom (UK), and having a maximum mass of 10 tonnes, crashes in France. 
 According to ICAO Annex 13 "Aircraft Accident and incident investigation", which State/organisation(s) must be notified of the accident and by whom?

options.text: France must notify the UK, the USA, and ICAO.
The USA must notify the UK, France, and ICAO.
The UK must notify France, the USA, and ICAO.
The USA, the UK, and France must be notified by ICAO.
No or Negative.
All personnel found.
Unable to continue - returning to base.
Nothing found, continuing search.

ACf13d0u.question: An operator shall not operate an aeroplane first issued with an individual Certificate of Airworthiness on or after 1 April **1998**, which has a maximum certificated take-off mass over 5 700 kg, unless it is equipped with a cockpit voice recorder which records: - voice communications transmitted from or received on the flight deck by radio. - the aural environment of the flight deck. - the cabin attendants communications in the cabin using the aeroplane's interphone system. - voice communications of flight crew members on the flight deck using the aeroplane's interphone system. - voice or audio signals identifying navigation or approach aids introduced into a headset or speaker. - voice communications of flight crew members on the flight deck using the public address system, if installed. The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:

HZkZHyAe.question: An operator shall not operate an aeroplane first issued with an individual Certificate of Airworthiness on or after 1 April **1998**, which has a maximum certificated take-off mass over 5 700 kg, unless it is equipped with a cockpit voice recorder which records: - Voice communications transmitted from or received on the flight deck by radio. - The aural environment of the flight deck. - The cabin attendants communications in the cabin using the aeroplane's interphone system. - Voice communications of flight crew members on the flight deck using the aeroplane's interphone system. - Voice or audio signals identifying navigation or approach aids introduced into a headset or speaker. - Voice communications of flight crew members on the flight deck using the public address system, if installed. The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:
